Si sceglie acido, freddo, fuoco, fulmine o veleno per il tipo di drago e potere draconico creato, quindi si effettua un attacco con incantesimo in mischia contro il bersaglio. Se l'attacco va a segno, la creatura subisce {@damage 3d8} danni del tipo scelto. In caso di successo, il bersaglio deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Forza o subire un colpo {@condition prone} fino all'inizio del suo prossimo turno.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shadow Breath
entries: Toccando una creatura consenziente, le si concede il potere di espellere energia d'ombra dalla bocca, a patto che ne abbia una. Finché l'incantesimo non termina, la creatura può usare un'azione per esalare energia d'ombra annerita in un cono di 15 piedi. Ogni creatura in quell'area deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Destrezza, subendo {@damage 3d6} danni necrotici se il tiro salvezza fallisce, o la metà dei danni se riesce. Una creatura che fallisce il tiro salvezza viene anche riempita di paura e diventa {@condition frightened} di voi fino alla fine del suo prossimo turno.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Silkstaff
entries: Nella mano libera si crea un bastone di seta indurita. Il bastone ha dimensioni e forma simili a quelle di un bastone da quarto e dura per tutta la durata. Se si lascia il bastone, questo appassisce, ma è possibile evocarlo di nuovo come azione bonus.

Si può usare la propria azione per effettuare un attacco con incantesimo in mischia con il bastone di seta. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 3d6} danni da percosse se si impugna il bastone con una mano, o {@dice 4d6} se lo si impugna con due mani.
Se si usa questo bastone per attaccare una pianta, si effettua l'attacco con vantaggio.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Skeletal Pain

components.m: a small bag of powdered bones

entries: Si invia un'esplosione di energia gassosa verso una creatura nel raggio d'azione che abbia uno scheletro. Un bersaglio senza scheletro è immune a questo incantesimo. Effettuare un attacco con incantesimo a distanza contro il bersaglio. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio viene tormentato dal dolore mentre le sue ossa tremano, subendo {@damage 3d6} danni necrotici.

Se il bersaglio è un non morto con scheletro, il non morto non subisce danni. Al contrario, è possibile prendere il controllo del non morto. Il bersaglio non-morto deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza contro la D.C. dell'incantesimo. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, l'energia avvolge la creatura, permettendole di muoversi fino al suo massimo movimento o di effettuare un singolo attacco contro una creatura a scelta nel suo raggio d'azione. Questo effetto dura solo per questo turno.

spell.name: Soul Spear
entries: Si strappa l'anima di una creatura nel raggio d'azione, estraendo parti della sua anima per danneggiarne un'altra. Come azione, scegliete una creatura che potete vedere entro 9 metri da voi e un'altra che si trovi entro 9 metri dalla prima creatura. Entrambe le creature devono effettuare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la prima creatura subisce {@damage 3d8} danni necrotici mentre una parte della sua anima viene strappata via da lei e si dirige verso la seconda creatura, che subisce {@damage 2d8} danni necrotici se il tiro salvezza fallisce.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Splinter Cannon
entries: L'avambraccio si trasforma in un grande cannone a forma di tronco d'albero. Per tutta la durata, non si possono impugnare oggetti con questo braccio. Quando si lancia questo incantesimo, e come azione bonus in ogni turno successivo, si può sparare un proiettile di legno appuntito contro un bersaglio nel raggio d'azione. Effettuare un attacco con incantesimo a distanza contro il bersaglio. Se viene colpito, la creatura subisce {@damage 2d8} danni da perforazione.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Spidersilk Whip
entries: Si infonde la magia a un piccolo ragno, facendogli sprigionare una frusta fatta di seta magica. La frusta ha dimensioni e forma simili a quelle di una frusta e dura per tutta la sua durata. Se si lascia la frusta, questa si disintegra, ma si può far evocare al ragno un'altra frusta di seta come azione bonus.

Si può usare la propria azione per effettuare un attacco di incantesimi in mischia con la frusta di seta. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 2d6} danni da acido. Se il bersaglio viene colpito, si può scegliere di costringerlo a effettuare un tiro salvezza di forza contro la propria DC di incantesimo, se è di taglia Grande o inferiore. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, il bersaglio subisce {@condition grappled} dalla frusta di seta. Una creatura può ripetere questo tiro salvezza all'inizio di ogni suo turno, oppure si può scegliere di terminare questo effetto a volontà.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Steam Breath

components.m: a piece of coal and a drop of water

entries: Dalla bocca si sprigiona un getto di vapore caldo in un cono di 9 metri. Ogni creatura in quell'area deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione. Se il tiro salvezza viene fallito, la creatura subisce {@damage 4d8} danni da fuoco e diventa {@condition blinded} per 1 minuto; in caso di successo, i danni si dimezzano. Una creatura può usare la propria azione per ripetere il tiro salvezza nel proprio turno, terminando l'effetto in caso di successo del tiro salvezza.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rdd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Steel Shot
entries: Si evoca un lungo dardo d'acciaio prima di scagliarlo contro una creatura visibile nel raggio d'azione. Effettuate un attacco con incantesimo a distanza contro il bersaglio. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 3d10} danni da perforazione e viene spinto indietro di 3 metri.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Storm Spear
entries: Evoca un fulmine che si trasforma in una lancia nella tua mano. Questa lancia magica dura fino alla fine dell'incantesimo. Conta come un'arma da mischia semplice con cui si è abili. Infligge {@damage 2d8} danni da fulmine se colpita e ha la proprietà lancio (gittata 20/60). Inoltre, quando si usa la lancia per attaccare un bersaglio che si trova in una tempesta o sotto la pioggia, si effettua il tiro per colpire con vantaggio.

Se si lascia cadere l'arma o la si lancia, si dissipa alla fine del turno. In seguito, finché l'incantesimo persiste, è possibile utilizzare un'azione bonus per far riapparire la lancia nella propria mano.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Torre's Attack

components.m: chess pieces of a rook and a bishop

entries: Il vostro atteggiamento diventa straordinariamente calmo mentre la vostra mano viene avvolta da un'energia pulsante a forma di torre degli scacchi. Effettuate un attacco con incantesimo in mischia contro il bersaglio. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 1d8} danni da forza e la sua CA è ridotta di 1 fino all'inizio del suo prossimo turno.
Per la durata dell'incantesimo, a ogni colpo andato a segno si infligge un ulteriore {@damage 1d8} danno da forza. In caso di fallimento, l'importo si ripristina al danno iniziale.

spell.name: Uncertainty
entries: Si cerca di invocare il movimento unico di un bersaglio a livello atomico. Scegliere un bersaglio nel raggio d'azione per effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la forma del bersaglio inizia a spostarsi rapidamente, confondendosi in un rapido movimento. All'inizio di ogni turno successivo per la durata dell'incantesimo, il bersaglio viene teletrasportato casualmente di 9 metri in uno spazio non occupato in una direzione determinata tirando sulla seguente tabella.

rows: West
Nord-Ovest
Nord
Nord-Est
East
Sud-Est
Sud
Sud-Ovest

spell.name: Veinblade
entries: Ci si taglia il braccio o il petto per creare una spada di sangue e ferro solidificato nella propria mano. Questa spada magica dura fino alla fine dell'incantesimo. Conta come un'arma da mischia semplice con cui si è abili. Infligge {@damage 2d8} danni necrotici al colpo e ha le proprietà finezza, luce e lancio (gittata 20/60). Inoltre, quando si usa la spada per attaccare un bersaglio che è al di sotto dei suoi punti ferita massimi, si recuperano punti ferita pari alla metà dei danni inflitti. I costrutti e i non morti sono immuni a questo effetto.

Se si lascia cadere l'arma o la si lancia, si dissipa alla fine del turno. In seguito, finché l'incantesimo persiste, è possibile utilizzare un'azione bonus per far riapparire la spada nella propria mano.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}.

spell.name: Ventriloquism
entries: Si proietta la propria voce in modo che sembri provenire da un punto visibile nel raggio d'azione. Per la durata dell'incantesimo, è possibile utilizzare un'azione bonus per cambiare il luogo da cui viene proiettata la voce.

Se una creatura usa la sua azione per esaminare questa proiezione della vostra voce, può determinare che si tratta di un'illusione con una prova di Intelligenza ({@skill Investigation}) riuscita contro la vostra DC di salvataggio dell'incantesimo. Se una creatura riconosce l'illusione per quello che è, sente la tua voce provenire da te.

spell.name: Warrior's Assault
entries: Si creano tre soldati spettrali e magici. Ogni soldato tenta di colpire una creatura a scelta che si vede nel raggio d'azione. Effettuare un tiro di attacco in mischia contro ogni creatura scelta. Un soldato spettrale infligge {@damage 2d8} danni da forza a chi lo colpisce. Si può scegliere che i soldati spettrali colpiscano tutti una creatura o più creature.
Una volta che un soldato spettrale ha sferrato il suo attacco, svanisce.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell creates one more spectral soldier for each slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Watery Grave
entries: Si evoca una pozza d'acqua vorticosa in una sfera di 3 metri di raggio, centrata su un punto nel raggio d'azione e che dura per tutta la durata. L'acqua vortica violentemente e al suo interno emergono lunghi tentacoli simili a polpi che si agitano.

Per la durata dell'incantesimo, l'area è un terreno difficile. Qualsiasi creatura che inizia il suo turno nell'area subisce {@damage 1d6} danni da percosse e {@damage 1d6} danni da freddo e deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Destrezza. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la creatura viene colpita {@condition grappled} dai tentacoli.

Come azione bonus nel proprio turno, si può comandare a uno dei tentacoli di scagliarsi contro una creatura nell'area dell'incantesimo o entro 2 metri dall'area. Effettuare un attacco con incantesimo in mischia contro il bersaglio. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 1d6} danni da percosse. Una creatura di taglia Grande o inferiore uccisa da questo incantesimo viene trascinata nelle profondità dell'acqua.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Witch Blades
entries: Lanciando in aria la terra della tomba, si evocano quattro armi eteree fatte di fiamme spettrali contro quattro spazi non occupati nel raggio d'azione, per tutta la durata dell'incantesimo o fino a quando non si lancia nuovamente l'incantesimo. Quando si lancia questo incantesimo, si può effettuare un attacco di incantesimo in mischia contro una creatura entro 2 metri da ciascuna arma evocata. Effettuare un attacco di incantesimo in mischia separato per ogni arma. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 1d4} danni necrotici. Se il bersaglio è {@condition charmed} o {@condition frightened}, i danni aumentano del {@dice 1d4}.
Come azione bonus nel proprio turno, si può muovere ogni arma fino a 3 metri e ripetere l'attacco contro una creatura entro 3 metri da essa.
Le armi possono assumere qualsiasi forma, come piccoli pugnali, falci o falcetti.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional weapon for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wind Glaive
entries: Si incanala il vento o la nebbia in modo da formare un velcro nella mano aperta. Questo veltro magico dura finché l'incantesimo non termina. Conta come un'arma da mischia semplice con cui si è abili. Infligge {@damage 2d8} danni da taglio o da percosse (a scelta) e ha le proprietà pesante, portata e a due mani. Inoltre, mentre questo incantesimo è attivo, si può usare la propria azione bonus per volare fino a 15 piedi senza provocare attacchi di opportunità.
Se si lascia cadere l'arma, questa si disperde in fumo bianco. In seguito, finché l'incantesimo persiste, è possibile utilizzare un'azione bonus per far riapparire il gladio nella propria mano.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} of your damage type choice, to a total of {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8}, each {@dice d8} corresponding to a damage type. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 5d8}, with {@dice 3d8} of one damage type and {@dice 2d8} of another.

spell.name: Wine Bomb
entries: Come azione, si estrae una bottiglia di alcol, come vino o birra, e la si scaglia contro un punto del terreno entro 9 metri. Al momento dell'impatto, la bottiglia esplode e l'area nel raggio di 3 metri intorno al punto si riempie di nebbia alcolica. Quando una creatura entra in quest'area per la prima volta in un turno o inizia il suo turno, deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la creatura diventa {@condition incapacitated} e i fumi rendono il bersaglio ubriaco.

Nei turni successivi la creatura può ripetere il tiro salvezza all'inizio di ogni suo turno, terminando l'effetto in caso di successo. Le creature subiscono l'effetto anche se trattengono il respiro. La nebbia si diffonde negli angoli. Persiste per 1 minuto e poi scompare o finché un forte vento non disperde la nebbia, ponendo fine all'effetto.

spell.name: Alekhine's Gun

components.m: chess pieces of two rooks and a queen

entries: Si tengono in mano i pezzi degli scacchi e si inviano tre pezzi spettrali delle due torri e della regina verso un bersaglio a portata di mano, nell'ordine: torre, torre, regina. Tirare separatamente per ogni forma. Se viene colpito, il bersaglio subisce {@damage 1d10} danni da forza per ogni torre e {@damage 2d10} danni da forza per la regina. Se tutti e tre i pezzi colpiscono il bersaglio, quest'ultimo deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Forza contro la propria D.C. di salvezza dell'incantesimo, oppure viene colpito {@condition prone} e spinto indietro di 3 metri.

spell.name: Alliance
entries: Tenendo la carta, si sceglie un bersaglio nel raggio d'azione che si può vedere. Il bersaglio deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, il bersaglio non può attaccarvi o danneggiarvi fino alla fine del suo turno successivo.

spell.name: Almighty Crush
entries: Si deforma la gravità che circonda due oggetti a scelta nel raggio di 120 piedi, ognuno dei quali non pesa più di 100 libbre. Come azione, inviate questi due oggetti a volare nell'aria verso un punto nel raggio d'azione. Tutte le creature che si trovano nella linea di viaggio di ciascun oggetto devono effettuare un tiro salvezza di Forza. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, una creatura subisce {@damage 4d6} danni da percussione e viene colpita {@condition prone} fino alla fine del suo turno successivo. Se il tiro salvezza riesce, la creatura subisce metà dei danni. Le creature che non possono muoversi effettuano questo tiro salvezza con svantaggio.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each spell slot above 3rd and the maximum weight of each object increases by 100 pounds.

spell.name: Animate Clockwork

components.m: A gear, copper wire, and a metal pipe

entries: Questo incantesimo crea un servitore meccanico di costrutto. L'incantesimo trasforma i componenti materiali con un'ondata di vita artificiale ed elettricità, elevandoli a creatura costrutto. Il bersaglio diventa un'armatura animata (il DM dispone delle statistiche di gioco della creatura).

In ogni turno, si può usare un'azione bonus per comandare mentalmente qualsiasi armatura animata creata con questo incantesimo, se si trova entro 60 piedi da noi (se si controllano più creature, si può comandare una o tutte allo stesso tempo, impartendo lo stesso comando a ciascuna di esse). Siete voi a decidere quale azione compirà la creatura e dove si muoverà durante il suo prossimo turno, oppure potete impartire un comando generale, come quello di sorvegliare una particolare camera o un corridoio. Se non si impartisce alcun comando, la creatura si difende solo dalle creature ostili. Una volta impartito un ordine, la creatura continua a seguirlo fino al completamento del suo compito.

La creatura è sotto il vostro controllo per 24 ore, dopodiché smette di obbedire a qualsiasi comando impartito. Per mantenere il controllo della creatura per altre 24 ore, è necessario lanciare nuovamente questo incantesimo sulla creatura prima che il periodo di 24 ore in corso finisca. Questo uso dell'incantesimo consente di riaffermare il controllo su un massimo di quattro creature che sono state animate con questo incantesimo, invece di animarne una nuova.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional animated armors for each slot above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different set of gears, copper wire, and metal pipes.

spell.name: Arcane Disturbance
entries: Si provoca il riempimento di un'area con un'energia che ostacola la magia. Un cubo di 30 piedi di energia increspata e traslucida si forma da un punto a scelta nel raggio d'azione. Gli incantesimi lanciati all'interno di quest'area vengono effettuati con svantaggio, mentre le creature che si trovano all'interno dell'area e che potrebbero essere influenzate da qualche proprietà magica, come una trappola, un incantesimo o un'altra fonte magica, hanno un vantaggio nei tiri salvezza contro tali effetti. I costrutti creati da incantesimi (come gli oggetti animati) o animati (come le armature animate) devono effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione contro la D.C. incantesimi quando entrano nell'area interessata, o diventare inattivi fino all'inizio del loro prossimo turno se il tiro salvezza è fallito.

spell.name: Bid
entries: Pescando tre carte, si annuncia una dichiarazione che si tenterà di fare prima dell'inizio del prossimo turno di combattimento, sperando di realizzarla. La dichiarazione deve essere pronunciata ad alta voce e deve essere chiara nelle intenzioni. Ogni dichiarazione fatta viene interpretata in base alla parola dichiarata, non in base all'intento della dichiarazione. Se una dichiarazione elencata di seguito si riferisce a un bersaglio, dovete dichiarare chi è il bersaglio e la vostra scelta non può cambiare una volta dichiarata.
Una dichiarazione può essere una delle seguenti:
Ridurre un bersaglio a 0 punti ferita.
Riuscire a colpire un bersaglio con un attacco di incantesimi a distanza.
Riuscire a colpire un bersaglio con un attacco di incantesimi in mischia.
Lanciare un incantesimo su un bersaglio che poi fallisce un tiro salvezza contro l'incantesimo.
Non si subisce alcun danno durante questo round di combattimento.
Potete anche fare una dichiarazione che non è elencata negli esempi precedenti. Se scegliete di farlo, dichiarate al DM la vostra dichiarazione nel modo più preciso possibile.

Se la dichiarazione viene eseguita, si recupera uno slot incantesimo di 1° livello. Se la dichiarazione non viene eseguita, si perde uno slot incantesimo di 1° livello. Se non si può riacquistare o perdere un incantesimo di 1° livello, si riacquistano o si perdono {@dice 2d8} punti ferita.

spell.name: Blade Garden

components.m: two daggers or a handful of sharp pieces of metal

entries: Si evocano lame di ferro dal sottosuolo che oscillano e si muovono costantemente. Queste lame erompono dal terreno in un raggio di 6 metri centrato su un punto nel raggio d'azione. L'area diventa terreno difficile per tutta la durata. Quando una creatura si muove all'interno dell'area, subisce {@damage 2d6} danni da taglio per ogni 5 piedi percorsi.

Mantenendo la concentrazione, come azione bonus in ogni turno, si può scegliere di estendere rapidamente le lame verso l'alto fino a 15 piedi. Le creature nell'area devono effettuare un tiro salvezza di Destrezza. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la creatura subisce {@damage 2d6} danni da perforazione, o la metà in caso di successo.

spell.name: Bone Shield
entries: Si crea uno scudo formato da ossa solide e resistenti. Questo scudo magico dura fino alla fine dell'incantesimo. Conta come un normale scudo con cui si è abili. Quando si è in possesso di questo scudo, si guadagna resistenza ai danni non magici da taglio, perforazione e percosse. Se si lascia cadere lo scudo o si perde la presa su di esso, cade e si frantuma. In seguito, finché l'incantesimo persiste, si può usare un'azione bonus per far riapparire lo scudo legato al braccio.

spell.name: Building Cards
entries: Pescando tre carte, si tenta di prolungare il tempo a disposizione di voi o di uno dei vostri alleati in un combattimento. Scegliete una delle seguenti opzioni:
Voi o un alleato a vostra scelta nel raggio d'azione guadagnate un'azione aggiuntiva durante questo round di combattimento.
Voi o un alleato a vostra scelta nel raggio d'azione guadagnate un'azione bonus aggiuntiva durante questo round di combattimento.
Voi o un alleato a vostra scelta nel raggio d'azione potete muovervi alla massima velocità di movimento durante questo round di combattimento.

Regardless of which option is chosen, the effect lasts until the end of the current round in combat. If you choose yourself, you take the additional action, bonus action, or additional movement on your turn. If you choose an ally, that ally takes their action, bonus action, or additional movement on their turn in combat (if they have not gone yet), or immediately after your turn in combat (if they have already gone).

spell.name: Butterfly Wall
entries: You summon forth a wall filled with fluttering butterflies on the ground at a point you can see within range. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 30 feet high, and 10 feet thick, and the butterfly vanish when the spell ends. It blocks line of sight but not movement. A creature who begins their turn or moves within the wall's space and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the butterflies and their speed is reduced to 0. A creature can repeat the saving throw as an action on their turn, ending the effect on a successful save.

spell.name: Cacophony
entries: You emit a powerful and loud sound, such as a scream or sang note. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who fail their saving throws are {@condition deafened} and {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Carrion Cloud

components.m: a feather and a piece of rotten meat

entries: You call forth a group of vultures that occupy a cube of 10 feet on each side, centered on a point within range. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} slashing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition frightened} of the vultures until the end of your next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Chains of Carceri
entries: Glowing mighty chains emerge quickly from the ground in a 30-foot square starting from a point within range. Each creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the chains until the spell ends. A creature {@condition restrained} by the chains can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d10} radiant damage.

You can also choose from one of the following creature types when you first cast this spell: celestials, constructs, fey, fiends, or undead. Creatures of the chosen type make their Strength saving throws at disadvantage.
When the spell ends, the chains slink back into the ground.

spell.name: Clockwork Trap

components.m: a handful of gears or a broken pocket watch

entries: You conjure a system of connected gears and machinery at a point of your choice within range. The gears occupy a 20-foot cube from that point for the duration. The gears and machinery are difficult terrain.

Each creature that starts its turn in the gears and machinery or that enters them during its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained} as long as it remains caught in the gears or until it breaks free.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the gears and machinery can use its actions to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. If it fails, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage as the gears continue to move against them.

The machinery is powered by magic and electricity, and can become overpowered. Any 5-foot cube of gears and machinery exposed to electricity or lightning conducts it and the gears and machinery begin working faster, dealing {@damage 2d4} lightning damage to any creature that starts its turn in the electrical overcharge.

spell.name: Drop Anchor
entries: You conjure a series of chains that end in anchors sailing through the air towards a creature within range. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become wrapped in the chains and anchors. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} for the spell's duration. A creature who succeeds on their saving throw takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}. An airborne creature affected by this spell descends to the ground at 60 feet per round until it reaches the ground or the spell ends.

A creature can attempt to break free of the chains and anchors by using its action to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage. On a success, the spell ends.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flamethrower

components.m: a piece or charcoal or flint

entries: A blast of engulfing fire erupts from you, forming a line 100 feet and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creatre takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw also becomes encased in flame, taking {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the beginning of their next turn.
The flames ignite flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Force Blast

components.m: one piece of ammunition or one thrown weapon

entries: You channel force energy into your hands. As an action, you unleash force energy in a 15-foot cone from your hands as you clasp them together. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a target takes {@damage 3d6} force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Heavenly Rings
entries: You conjure up three 1-inch thick glowing planetary rings around you, that constantly rotate and spin at slow speeds. The rings float around you, occupying space. When a creature enters the area of one of the rings for the first time or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} radiant damage on a failed save and is pushed back 10 feet, or half as much damage on a successful one. The outermost ring then dissipates into dust.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can increase or decrease the radius of the outermost ring from you by 5 feet, to a maximum of 15 feet away from you.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create one additional ring for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ironblood

m.text: an iron bracelet worth at least 10 gp

entries: You transform your exposed blood into hardened iron that protects your skin. When you first cast this spell, if you have taken damage, your AC increases by 1, so long as you are not wearing armor or carrying a shield. While this spell is active, once per round when you take damage and successfully maintain concentration on this spell, your blood hardens to grant you an additional +1 to your AC. Each time you must roll to maintain concentration on this spell, you subtract from the roll an amount equal to the AC bonus you have received from this spell, as the blood loss strains the body. When this spell ends, the hardened iron on your body breaks into dust, and your AC returns to normal.
This spell ends if you begin wearing any armor or use a shield.

spell.name: Iron Skeleton

components.m: a small piece of metal, such as an ingot, a gear, or a knife

entries: You throw the piece of metal to a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning or piercing damage, your choice. If the creature has a skeleton, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's bones begin to become encased in metal, and the creature's speed is reduced by half, and whenever the creature moves more than 5 feet, the metal pierces into their body, dealing {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. A creature who fails this saving throw also makes saving throws against spells that deal lightning damage at disadvantage.
A creature can use their action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Light-Particle Laser
entries: A powerful beam of blinding, condensed light forming a line of 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. This line can pass through solid objects up to 1 foot thick. creature takes {@damage 8d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw is {@condition blinded} for up to 1 minute. A creature who is {@condition blinded} can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Magresima
entries: Your eyes become glossed over in black and turquoise colors as you attune yourself to atomic waves. For the duration of the spell or until your concentration ends, you can see all creatures, including hidden and {@condition invisible} ones, regardless of lighting conditions, within 60 feet of you, and you can see through walls and other solid objects and structures up to 5 feet thick within the same distance. All creatures appear to you as blackened outlines with their skeletal and organ structure visible to you.

spell.name: Plutarch's Square
entries: You conjure forth three spectral copies of yourself, with two occupying either side of you in a 5 foot unoccupied space, and one occupying a 5 foot unoccupied space behind you. Each copy moves with you in the same formation and faces away from you. For the spell's duration, you gain the following benefits:

You cannot be surprised. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, and if something is noticed in a direction that a copy is facing when you make the check, your copy speaks and alerts you of what it sees. Creatures cannot gain advantage on an attack roll made against you as a result of flanking. You do not provoke opportunity attacks when moving away from a creature.

spell.name: Quantum Amplification

components.m: a pinch of fine, grey dust

entries: You touch a creature, briefly emitting within it a quick pulse of energy before bestowing it with atomic protection. For the duration, the target has advantage on Constitution saving throws, and has resistance to force damage.

spell.name: Quantum Particle Dissimilation
entries: You call forth bright white energy that completely fills a 5-foot cube centered on a point within range. Each creature in a 5-foot cube centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are obliterated to nothing. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

This spell automatically disintegrates a Medium or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 5-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Scythe Winds
entries: You transform the winds around you into swirling blades of air. Choose up to four targets you can see within range. Each target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d10} slashing damage, or half as much on a successful save. A creature who fails their saving throw is also {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn, and is pushed back 10 feet.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shielding Spirit
entries: A glowing spectral figure that assumes the form of an angel, beast, or knight appears and protects you. You gain a +3 bonus to AC against the triggering attack. Should the attack miss, as part of the same reaction, the spectral figure strikes out against the attacker. Make a ranged or melee spell attack roll against the attacking target. On a hit, the spectral figure deals {@damage 4d8} radiant damage to the target. The spectral figure then disappears.

spell.name: Solar Flare
entries: Channeling the power of the sun, you unleash a blinding blast of solar energy. Each creature within a 15-foot radius sphere centererd on you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage and {@dice 2d8} radiant on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw becomes {@condition blinded} until the beginning of their next turn. Creature who cannot be {@condition blinded} are immune to this effect, and creatures who with sun sensitivity make the saving throw at disadvantage.
This spell ignites any flammable object within the spell's range.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} fire and {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Spear of Xaphedo
entries: You conjure forth a glowing spear in your empty hand. You then hurl the spear in a line of 90 feet long out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw is knocked {@condition prone}.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Voice of the Gravekeeper

components.m: a small silver trinket, and a stick of incense

entries: You touch a coffin, grave, sarcophagus, or tombstone as your eyes become glossed over. Visions begin pouring into your head, and you receive information about the creature within the coffin, grave, sarcophagus, or under the tombstone. The spell fails if the creature that is an undead.
You learn several pieces of information about the corpse from when it was still alive. For each minute that passes, you learn one piece of information, in the following order:
What creature type it was.
How long the creature has been dead.
How old the creature was when it died.
What the creature's name was, if it had one.
In what manner the creature died, such as by physical trauma or disease.
If the creature was under the effects of a spell or other magical effect when it died.

What the creature experienced through its senses on its last day while alive, presented to you through simple sensory effects, such as suddenly smelling certain scents or seeing blurry, rough outlines of what it saw.
What the creature experienced emotionally on its last day while alive, presented to you in the form of simple emotional states such as brief feelings of anger, fear, or happiness.
What the creature's last 20 words were before it died, if it had the capability of speech.
A clear mental image of the last thing the creature saw before it died, if it had the capability of sight. If not, you can choose the last thing the creature tasted, smelled, touched, or heard.
If you cast this spell again on the same corpse, you learn no new information, but the same information presented to you before.

spell.name: Zarant's Clockwork Fusillade

components.m: at least one gear and a copper wire

entries: You extend your arms and transform gears and copper wires into a mechanical cannon in front of you that bombards creatures within range with your choice of fire, lightning, or piercing rounds. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire, lightning, or piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature you fails their saving throw is pushed back 10 feet from the force of the bombardment.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aeran's Wall of Lightning
entries: You conjure forth a wall of lightning on a solid surface within range. The lightning can appear in any color of your choice, such as blue, gold, red, or black. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 foot think, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot think. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} lightning damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. Creatures wearing metal armor or are made of metal make their saving throw at disadvantage.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals {@damage 5d8} lightning damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The other side of the wall deals no damage.
If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell borrows strength from the existing storm. Under such conditions, the spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8}.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Antimatter Surge
entries: You emit a blast of antimatter energy in a 60-foot cone from you. Each creature must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 7d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw feels the force of the blast wrack their body at a microscopic level, and the creature becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn. If damage from this spell reduces a target to 0 hit points, the target is turned into fine grey dust.

spell.name: Arcane Guardian

m.text: an gem inlaid amulet worth 200 gp

entries: You call upon the Weave to provide you aid in the form of an arcane guardian, a spectral entity that assumes the form of either a beast, a humanoid warrior, or a humanoid mage. This arcane guardian lasts until the spell ends. For the spell's duration, the arcane guardian moves with you, floating directly above and behind you, though it occupies your space. The arcane guardian provides you with the following benefits:

items: Your spell attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage on a hit

Creatures who move within 5 feet of you provoke opportunity attacks from your arcane guardian. Make a melee spell attack roll. On a hit, the arcane guardian deals {@damage 2d8} force damage to the target.

spell.name: Assimilation

m.text: a plant native to the land you are currently in, incense worth at least 150 gp, and a symbol worth at least 10 gp representing the country of your current location

entries: Whenever you cast this spell, you learn information about the local culture and land. The spell brings to your mind a brief analysis of the local customs, accent, dialect, beliefs, and behaviors of the local culture. This information might consist of slang words or phrases, what gods or deities are worshipped and why, mannerisms and gestures that the local populace act out or avoid, or the preferred clothing style or choice of food.

If you are a foreigner, you receive a basic but informative list of information. If you are a native to the culture, you gain additional knowledge that you would not have already known. For the spells Duration, you have advantage on Charisma checks to pass yourself off as one of the locals of the country. A suspicious creature can make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check at disadvantage to ascertain your true nature and identity. On a success, the creature knows you're trying to impersonate a native of the country.

spell.name: Astral Cannon

components.m: a small figure of a star, moon, or sun, made of iron

entries: You extend your arm outward with a clenched fist as small glowing rings and stars begin to surround your arm. A beam of celestial star energy blasts out from you forming a line of 90 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} force damage and {@damage 5d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw is also pushed back 10 feet and is {@condition blinded} until the beginning of their next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each damage type for every two spell slots used above 4th.

spell.name: Atomic Shield

components.m: a pinch of fine grey dust

entries: The air around you vibrates and pulses as hundreds of tiny, white spherical particles orbit rapidly around your body for the duration. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

For the duration of the spell, ranged weapon attacks against you are made at disadvantage. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, a cluster of particles lashes out at the attacking creature. The attacker takes {@damage 2d8} force damage from the shield. If damage from this spell reduces a target to 0 hit points, the target is turned into fine grey dust.

spell.name: Atomic Warhead

m.text: a small 1-inch metal ball, which the spell consumes

entries: You toss a 1-inch metal ball into the air before it streaks towards a point within range, exploding in a blast of bright white atomic energy in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d4} force damage and {@damage 5d4} radiant damage and is pushed back 10 feet in a straight line and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and is not pushed back or knocked {@condition prone}.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each damage type for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Black Mark
entries: You touch a creature, and that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a black circle appears on the creature where you touched them, and the creature becomes cursed with the black mark. While cursed, the following effects occur:
The cursed creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks and saving throws, and creatures within a 10-foot radius of the cursed creature have disadvantage on Charisma saving throws.
Creatures within a 10-foot radius of the cursed creature must make a Constitution saving throw or use their action to begin retching.
The cursed creature's is unable to breathe water, if they could before, and their swim speed is reduced by half.
A remove curse spell cast from a 4th level spell slot or higher ends these effects.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 6th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Conjure Raijū
entries: You conjure forth six wolves cloaked in lightning, each wolf occupying a 5-foot square in unoccupied spaces above you. Whenever a creature begins their turn or moves within a 15-foot radius around you, one of these wolves immediately flies towards the creature. Make a melee spell attack roll for the wolf. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage and it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. After a wolf attacks a creature, it vanishes in a flash of light.
If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the wolves become highly aggressive, and a wolf has advantage on their attack roll against a creature.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the number of wolves created increase by two for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Consume Soul
entries: You approach a corpse of a creature who has not been dead for longer than three days. As an action, you open your mouth and pull forth a part of their soul into you, gaining {@dice 3d10} temporary hit points. Any creature within 60 feet of you must make a Charisma saving throw, or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of temporary hit points gained increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot above 4th.

spell.name: Crimson Expulsion
entries: You cause a creature to lose a vast amount of blood. Choose a creature within range to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. The creature takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success as a wound suddenly opens, causing blood to spray out up to 10 feet. Creatures who fail this saving throw also have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws until the end of their next turn. Constructs and undead are immune to this effect.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Dematerialization
entries: You deconstruct your body at the atomic level, causing you to disappear in a quick cloud of fine grey dust. You can move up to 100 feet, and you can pass through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Doing so does not provoke opportunity attacks against you. If the object you pass through would normally cause damage, such as a wall of fire, you take no damage when passing through it. You take {@damage 6d6} force damage if you end your turn inside an object or creature. Once you arrive at an unoccupied space of your choice, you materialize into your normal form.

spell.name: Faresa's Draconic Form
entries: Arcane energy surrounds your body in the shape of a dragon, the color of which is your choice when you cast this spell. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a flying speed of 30 feet.
When you hit a target with an unarmed strike, that target takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.
You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic form.

You gain a breath weapon, the damage type of which corresponds to the color of the draconic energy around you. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in 15-foot area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic energy. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save.

entries: Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Molecular Shredding Sphere
entries: A sphere of blinding, white atomic energy encloses a creature or object of Large size or smaller within range. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d12} force damage, or half as much on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw becomes {@condition stunned} until the beginning of their next turn, as their body tries to recover from the molecular tearing it felt. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

spell.name: Mudslide
entries: You slam both hands on the ground while facing your enemies, causing a mud wave to explode from the ground in a line that shoots towards them. The line travels 30 feet in the direction you are facing and has a width of 15 feet.

Each creature in the wave must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, and half as much damage on a succesful one and is not knocked {@condition prone}.
This uprooting of the land turns the wave's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Nathaniel's Ghost Breath
entries: You touch one willing creature and grant it with the ability to spew forth ethereal wind from its mouth, provided it has one. The exhaling of the wind sounds like the wails of mournful spirits. Until the spell ends, the creature can use an action to exhale energy from the Ethereal Plane in a 30-foot cone. Incorporeal undead make this saving throw at disadvantage. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Novronian's Purple Lightning
entries: You send forth bolts of purple lightning towards creatures of your choice within a 20-foot radius of you. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d10} lightning damage, and half as much on a successful save.

A creature who fails their saving throw then becomes {@condition frightened} of you until the end of their next turn, and whenever the creature moves, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage for each 5 feet of movement.

spell.name: Pit of Lava

components.m: a pinch of volcanic ash and a piece of obsidian

entries: You conjure forth a gaping pit of lava within range. You create a dimensional 10-foot-by-10-foot hole with a depth of 10 feet with a 5-foot-deep pool of molten lava at the bottom of the pit. Creatures within the area of effect must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the creature lands 10 feet away from the edge of the lava pit in an unoccupied space. On a failed save, a creature falls into the pit and takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage. In addition, flammable non-magical items carried or worn by a creature in the pit are set aflame.

You must conjure this lava pit on a horizontal surface of sufficient size. Since it extends into another dimension, the pit has no weight and does not otherwise displace the original underlying material. You can create the pit in the deck of a ship as easily as in a dungeon floor or the ground of a forest.

The walls outlying the pit are covered with sharp rocks, and a creature who attempts to climb out of the pit must make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC, falling back into the pit on a failed save.
When the spell ends, creatures within the pit rise up with the bottom of the pit.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the size of the hole increases by an additional 10-feet-by-10-feet for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Quantum Cryptography

components.m: a small 1-inch metal box surrounded in a series of copper wire

entries: You and one other creature of your choice form a special link that allows the two of you to communicate across vast distances. When you first cast this spell, you creature a passcode that only you and the creature with whom you form this link with know. When you send a long message of fifty words or less to a creature with whom you are familiar, the creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.

Any creature outside of you and the creature you form this link with who attempts to intercept or hear a message only hears gibberish and nonsense, and the message cannot be deciphered without the passcode.

When you cast this spell, you can create another link with a second creature and create a new passcode. When you do so, the link you have formed with the previous creature is broken. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence.

spell.name: Ravaging Rain
entries: A torrent of heavy rainfall hails from the sky in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. The area is considered heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

The ground in the area is covered in water, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone} and takes {@damage 4d4} bludgeoning damage as rain continues to pelt them, or half as much damage on a success.

spell.name: Rejuvenating Cocoon
entries: You touch a willing creature and have the moth caterpillars move across the creatures body, surrounding it in a silken moth caterpillar cocoon.

For the spell's duration, or until you use an action to touch the target and dismiss the spell, the target cannot be observed by any outward inspection. The target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition incapacitated}, and its speed drops to 0. The target has resistance to all damage except psychic damage. While inside the cocoon, the target regains {@dice 4d6} hit points. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

spell.name: Shellshock
entries: A massive bolt of blue lightning strikes the ground at a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw is also wracked by the experience, and becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute.
The spell damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Skeletal Sword Dance
entries: Long, sharp protruding bones emerge from out of your elbows and palms as you begin to quickly spin around. You hurl yourself into a spinning dance, quickly moving in a straight line to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of the line you travel must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Speak With Texts

m.text: a blank sheet of parchment, incense worth at least 25 gp, and a piece of glass, and a stack of books, parchment, or scrolls

entries: While standing near a single bookshelf, stack of books or scrolls, or other container filled with books, scrolls, or parchment, you can commune with the books or scrolls. You may ask the books or scrolls any question, and the books or scrolls immediately find the most relevant and useful information to you that they can by having the appropriate text glow faintly and float to you, regarding a question that you may ask of it. If you cannot read the written text, a voice emits from the book or scroll that reads it out loud to you in a language that you understand. For the spell's duration, you have advantage on any {@skill History} check that you make related to any information provided to you by the bookshelf or stack of books or scrolls.

spell.name: Spencer's Hearty Pig
entries: You conjure forth a healthy, beautiful pig at an unoccupied space within range. As soon as the pig is summoned, it begins either speaking or singing. If it speaks, it tells terrible jokes or bad advice. If it sings, it sings off key and off tempo. Each creature within a 20-foot radius of the pig becomes visibly distracted, and has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of your next turn. At the end of your next turn, the pig disappears in a puff of smoke.

The pig is impervious to all damage and cannot be targeted by any spell aside from the dispel magic spell. The pig is also immune to all conditions, cannot perform any other action aside from speaking or singing, and any attempt to convince it that its jokes, advice, or singing is wrong or terrible automatically fail.

spell.name: Steinitz's Chessboard

components.m: chess pieces of a rook and a bishop

entries: A translucent chess board appears on the ground beneath a 40-foot long, 40-foot wide 10-foot high area centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, dim light fills the area.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is slammed by a 5-foot tall chess piece made of translucent energy, and it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. At Higher levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 4th.

spell.name: Summon Plants

components.m: one leaf or twig per creature summoned

entries: You summon plant creatures that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears.

items: One plant creature of challenge rating 2 or lower
Two plant creatures of challenge rating 1 or lower
Four plant creatures of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
Eight plant creatures of challenge rating 1/4 or lower

entries: A summoned creature wilts to nothing when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The DM has the creatures' statistics.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear - twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

spell.name: Wall of Cards
entries: A series of glowing cards forming a wall of cards appears at a point you choose within range. The wall of cards appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. It emits bright light out to 15 feet and dim light for an additional 15 feet. Additionally, creatures and objects can pass through it.

The wall is 1 inch thick and is composed of ten 10-foot-by-15-foot cards. Each card must be contiguous with at least one other card. Alternatively, you can create 10-foot-by-20-foot cards that are 3 inches thick.
If the wall of cards cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice).

Until the spell ends, you can use an action to cause one of the cards to emit a copy of itself, moving it forward before turning to its side and spinning rapidly towards one creature you can see within 60 feet of it. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} force damage. Whether you hit or miss, reduce the length of the wall by 10 feet. If the wall's length drops to 0 feet, the spell ends.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wall of Plagues
entries: A wall of thick, dark colored fog emerges from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes one continuous path along the ground. The wall lasts for the duration.

When the wall of dark fog appears, each creature within its area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful save.

Ranged attacks that would pass through the wall are made at disadvantage, and creatures and objects can still pass through the wall. However, whenever a creature or object passes through the wall, it must make another Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins choking and must spend its action that turn fetching and reeling.
A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the wall after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) disperses it after 1 round.

spell.name: Cloak of Illness

m.text: three dead flies and an onyx worth at least 200 gp

entries: Small insects, vermin, and dark colored fumes surround your body until the spell ends, causing you to become a frightening sight to others. Each creature within 30 feet of you that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for the spell's duration. A creature who fails their saving throw can repeat it as an action on their turn, ending the effect on a success.

Until the spell ends, you have resistance to poison and acid damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with an attack, poisonous fumes are breathed in by that creature, dealing it {@damage 2d10} poison damage.

spell.name: Crystal Breath

m.text: a crystal worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You summon crystals to send towards your foes. As an action, you break the crystal in your hands or on the ground, sending forth a magical blast of shining energy in a 60 foot cone, causing crystals to erupt from the earth. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 4d8} piercing damage and {@damage 4d8} force damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

Creatures who fail the saving throw also have crystals begin to cover their body, and their speed is reduced by half. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the beginning of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Earthen Fissure

components.m: a handful of dirt, sand, or mud

entries: The user weaves a hand sign before slamming their hand into the ground to create a fissure in the earth. The fissure can be caused anywhere within 30 feet of you, and us formed in a linear style that is 60 feet long, 20 feet wide, and 20 feet deep. All creatures caught in the fissure's range must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or fall into the fissure and take {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save as the target falls into the fissure. On a successful save, the target is able to dodge the fissure.

The wall of the fissure nearly flat with only narrow footholds, small rock outcroppings, or mangled roots to support someone climbing. Creatures attempting to climb out of the fissure must make a {@skill Athletics} check against your spell save DC to climb the side of the wall. Creatures who have natural climbing speeds make this check with advantage.

Creatures who are still in the fissure when it closes just make another Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save and half as much on a success as they are pushed out of the closing fissure.

spell.name: Energy Barrage

m.text: a gem or crystal worth at least 100 gp

entries: You unleash a massive volley of thousands of small streaking bolts of arcane energy soar into the sky, striking the affected area before disappearing in tiny bursts. Choose a point within range. Each creature in a 30-foot radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature who fails their saving throw is knocked {@condition prone} until the beginning of their next turn.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius increases by an additional 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Firing Squad

components.m: one simple or martial ranged weapon

entries: Five illusory duplicates of yourself appear with you, occupying your space. While you are wielding a simple or martial ranged weapon, each duplicate of yourself also wields the same weapon. Both you and each of the duplicates can then make a ranged attack against creatures within a 60-foot line originating from you. Roll a ranged weapon attack for both yourself and each duplicate. On a hit, a target takes damage equal to the damage of the ranged weapon you are wielding. When the spell ends, the duplicates fade away.

spell.name: Garden of Bones

components.m: a handful of small animal bones, a pinch of salt

entries: You slam a hand holding the material components onto the ground. The ground in a 30-foot radius centered on you shakes as sharpened bones emerge, shooting upward. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can quickly extend sharp bones to pierce a creature within the affected area. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or be pinned by the bones, becoming {@condition restrained}.

Until the spell ends, you can direct the sharpened bones towards another creature in the area to attempt to restrain them as a bonus action on each of your turns. You can affect only one creature like this at a time.

spell.name: Grave's Embrace

components.m: a skull or rib bone, a pinch of salt, and a drop of oil

entries: You summon forth a large, spectral form of a humanoid skeleton that includes the ribs, spine, arms, and head. This spectral skeleton is encased in translucent, writhing flames or energy (the color of which is of your choice). Choose a target within range to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target becomes trapped by the spectral skeleton, either by being held in the skeleton's hands or being trapped within its rib cage.

While trapped by the skeleton, the target's movement speed is reduced to 0, and it is immune to attacks made against it from outside of the spectral skeleton. At the beginning of each of its turns, the target takes {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage, and its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to one fourth of the damage taken.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC to try to escape. On a success, it frees itself from the grasp of the spectral skeleton, though the spectral skeleton still remains if the spell is still up. On a failed save, the creature takes an additional {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Lesser Time Stop
entries: You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. No time passes for other creatures, while you take 2 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal.

This spell ends if one of the actions you use during this period, or any effects that you create during this period, affects a creature other than you or an object being worn or carried by someone other than you. In addition, the spell ends if you move to a place more than 300 feet from the location where you cast it.

spell.name: Gravity Blast
entries: Gravitational energy gathers around you before you send forth a powerful blast. Each creature in a 30-foot cube must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is pushed back 60 feet, and half as much on a successful save. A creature who gets pushed into something, such as another creature or a building, takes {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet they are pushed back before hitting that creature or building. A creature who is pushed off of a solid surface begins falling.
In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 60 feet away from you by the spell's effect.

spell.name: Summon Construct

components.m: a small metal figurine of a creature, or a handful of iron or steel pieces, or a handful of gears

entries: You call forth an construct servant. Choose an area that fills a 10-foot cube within range. A construct of challenge rating 5 or lower appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The construct disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The construct is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the construct, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the construct, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your concentration is broken, the construct doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the construct, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled construct can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it. The DM has the construct's statistics.
entriesHigherLevel: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wall of Sound

components.m: an instrument a small bell, or a chime

entries: A translucent wall of sound appears at a point you choose within range. The wall emits a faint humming noise, however should a creature or object touch the wall, the wall bursts into a loud, vibrating noise that lasts for a few seconds after it has been touched. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick. It lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice which side).

Whenever a creature or object touches the wall, it must make a Constitution saving throw, or take {@damage 6d8} thunder damage on a failed save and half as much on a success. Creatures who fail their saving throws are {@condition deafened} until the beginning of their next turn.
Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage though both the dispel magic and silence spells can dispel it.

spell.name: Wood Shape

components.m: a small piece of wood that must be whittled into roughly the desired shape of the wooden object

entries: You touch a wooden object of Large size or smaller or a section of wood no more than 15 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a large piece of wood into a weapon, idol, or a small unfurnished hut, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a wooden door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

spell.name: Acidic Arrow Volley

components.m: one piece of ammunition or one thrown weapon

entries: You toss the piece of nonmagical ammunition or nonmagical thrown weapon into the air and choose a popint within range. Hundreds of duplicates of the ammunition or weapon fall in a volley from above and then litter the ground. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The hundreds of ammunition then turn into small pools of acid, making the area become difficult terrain until the beginning of your next turn.

spell.name: Create Construct

components.m: a set of heavy armor for each animated armor, a spool of copper wire, and a dozen gears

entries: Choose a set of heavy armor that you have gathered. Each set of heavy armor transforms and animates to become an animated armor under your control. (The DM has game statistics for these creatures.)

As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you have given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to three creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating new ones.
